title: Gamification-Based Instructional Design for Learning Spatial Building Volume

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental geometry concepts and understanding of volume calculation formulas
context.additional_context: The need to cultivate practical mathematical skills for professionals to solve spatial design problems linked to real work environments

learning_goals: Learners can apply spatial building volume calculation rules with 80% accuracy using the Mechanics component of the MDA framework.
Learners can independently solve volume calculation problems for complex spatial structures (rectangular prisms, cylinders, cones, etc.) at a rate of 70% or higher through gamification activities.
Learners can establish dynamic (Dynamics) problem-solving strategies for spatial optimization challenges via team-based game activities and perform at least three simulation validations.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
